documents.title: our live coverage today
text: live updates have now ended , but keep an eye out for more news , sport and travel into the weekend .
we 'll be back with you from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: it will stay cloudy throughout the night with some isolated showers possible and lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: on midlands today : car cloning 'on rise ' and arson attack on shop
text: on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one we 'll hear how drivers are being warned by police that `` car cloning '' appears to be on the rise in the west midlands .
we 'll also update you on the disappearance of 10 cats from one street in the space of a week .
and the latest on a suspected arson attack on a shop in coventry that 's left its polish owner devastated .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police misconduct charges thrown out
text: a misconduct panel has dismissed the charges facing a police officer based in the coventry and solihull areas .
pc michelle felton was facing a charge of gross misconduct accused of stealing fuel while off duty .

documents.title: take a peek inside tata 's new leamington headquarters
text: global engineering firm tata technologies offered an exclusive preview of its multimillion-pound headquarters in leamington .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: museum could close due to budget cuts
text: st john 's house museum , in warwick , could be closed under proposed council budget cuts .
a consultation is currently running looking at 43 % cuts to warwickshire 's culture budget in order to save £ 67m by 2020 .
council leader izzi seccombe said any decisions would be made on an `` informed basis '' .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: latest : suspected arson attack on polish shop ; former teacher charged with sex offences
text: here 's a recap of some of our main stories :
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: michael portillo : politicians still 'whinging ' about brexit
text: the former government minister michael portillo says it 's about time the uk got on with dealing with brexit rather than politicians `` still whinging about it '' .

speaking on a trip to coventry , the former defence minister said he believed leaving the european union was great for business here and the eu would need the uk to help it out of its own financial problems .
`` the british people have made a decision , '' he said , `` and we have to execute it as best as we possibly can '' .
`` what we 're actually seeing is many people now trying to resist the government 's attempts to trigger article 50 and i think all of that is unhelpful . ''

documents.title: mark venus in charge at coventry city 'until further notice '
text: interim manager of coventry city mark venus will continue to look after first-team affairs until further notice , said the club .
venus took up the position following tony mowbray 's departure at the end of last month and has guided the team to victories against port vale and northampton town .
at a pre-match press conference today , he said he expected to be in charge at least until january .
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: former teacher and youth leader charged with child sex offences
text: a former teacher from cubbington has been charged with 21 counts of historical child sex offences .
david wesley , 64 , has been charged with :
the alleged incidents are said to have taken place between 1971 and 1992 whilst wesley was a teacher at north leamington school and a youth leader at the cubbington methodist church .

documents.title: sisu snubs coventry city takeover approach and insist club is not for sale
text: a fan-led takeover approach for coventry city has been blocked by owners sisu , who have insisted the club is not for sale .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: video : the cricketer killed at the somme who inspired literary character
text: warwickshire cricketer percy jeeves died 100 years ago fighting at the somme .
his name and dapper style inspired one of english literature 's most famous comic characters .
author: Giles Latcham
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: £ 2.5m for superfast broadband in coventry
text: internet speeds in coventry are set to be boosted with a £ 2.5m investment in superfast broadband .
we want to encourage businesses to locate in coventry , creating employment , '' the city council 's cabinet member for finance john mutton told me .
the plans still need to go to the labour group for approval and are thought likely to be implemented next year .
the conservative opposition group leader john blundell welcomed the news , but said everybody in coventry should have superfast broadband .
i do n't know how far that 's going to go , '' he said , questioning whether the £ 2.5m would be enough .
any housing development should have , as a planning condition , superfast broadband . ''
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: video : polish shopkeeper is `` devasted '' by a suspected arson attack
text: the polish owner of a coventry shop destroyed in a suspected arson attack says he ca n't understand why it was targeted .
norbet krupan , who opened the shop in willenhall a year ago , said the fire had left him `` devastated '' .

documents.title: man hit by car seriously injured
text: a pedestrian was seriously injured when he was hit by a car in coventry last night .
the ambulance service was called to the crash at the junction of sky blue way and walsgrave road , in coventry , at about 23:30 .
it says the man sustained multiple serious injuries and needed advanced trauma care .

documents.title: european cup : wasps team news
text: captain joe launchbury returns to the starting 11 tomorrow as wasps face italian visitors zebre rugby at the ricoh arena in the opening group fixture of the european cup .
tom cruse makes his second start for the club following a strong debut against saracens .
tommy taylor is named on the bench , after sickness ruled him out of last sunday 's match .
team news : here 's the wasps side to face @ twitterid at the @ twitterid in the @ twitterid opener tomorrow , ko 1pm
time for a european adventure allez allez allez @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
cracking displays all round today just a quick
good luck to all the lads today # allezallezallez @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
that 's a more full strength side than i was expecting !
here 's to a great performance boys !
we mean business

we 've had a hard start to the season .
there are some lv games looming to rest more i think

jimmy gopperth on the bench
rather looking forward to seeing that side tomorrow
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: 'arson attack ' destroys polish shop
text: 'arson attack ' destroys polish shop

documents.title: on today 's programme
text: a hundred years ago , men of the birmingham pals battalions were fighting on the somme - a world war one battle that claimed so many british lives .
among their number was a brilliant warwickshire cricketer , percy jeeves , whose name and dapper style inspired one of english literature 's most famous comic creations .
tonight on @ twitterid @ twitterid remembers percy jeeves outstanding @ twitterid all-rounder cut down on the somme 100 years ago
fascinating piece , interesting and sadly tragic .
thanks to all for this work .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: coventry half marathon under threat
text: there 's a call for the city council to take over the organisation of the coventry half marathon after the company that 's been running it pulled out .
go2 events , who 've staged the 13-mile run for the past three years , say they do n't want to carry on with their current agreement .
conservative councillor tim mayer says there 's now an opportunity for the authority to take control and self-fund the event through advertising revenues .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: some bright spells of sunshine will be around this afternoon , with the chance of an odd shower and highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: rugby town 's elliot palmer 'recovering at home '
text: rugby town footballer elliot palmer has left hospital and is recovering at home , say the club .
the 21-year-old defender suffered three broken ribs and bleeding on the kidney and liver after the match against local rivals bedworth united .
good news on elliot palmer - elliot is now out of hospital and recovering at home after his injury last saturday at @ twitterid # valley
great news eliot p hope the recovery is rapid see you through the season our best wishes bufc

documents.title: latest : suspected arson attack destroys polish shop ; future of coventry half marathon
text: some of our headlining stories are :
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: owner 'devastated and confused ' after shop destroyed in suspected arson attack
text: the owner of a polish shop in coventry destroyed in a suspected arson attack says he 's `` devastated '' .
norbert krupan , who 's lived in the area for seven years and opened the shop a year ago , said he was just `` confused '' .
`` we 've had it confirmed that we 've been targeted and someone 's done this deliberately '' , he said .
`` the police ask me if it was maybe a racial background , or maybe the competition , i really do n't know . ''
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: your west midlands questions answered
text: your west midlands questions answered

documents.title: video : how warwickshire inspired george eliot
text: the bbc has launched its love to read campaign , where lovers of literature are being asked to share their favourite books .
across the country famous novels which have been shaped by the local landscape are being celebrated .
one of the greatest novelists of all time , george eliot , was hugely influenced by the warwickshire countryside - as lindsay doyle has been finding out .
there 's a special programme on sunday about midlands authors : books that made britain , birmingham : factories to middle earth on 16 october , 15:45 on bbc one and afterwards on the bbc iplayer .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: stratford taxi driver suspended
text: a taxi driver in stratford has been suspended after carrying too many passengers - four of whom were children with special needs on their way to school .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: forensic investigation begins at polish shop destroyed by fire
text: police say it 's too early to confirm if a suspected arson attack on a polish shop in coventry will be investigated as a hate crime .
forensic investigators from west midlands police will visit the scene of the fire , which completely destroyed the unit in remembrance road .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : car fire on the m40
text: one lane remains closed on the m40 for recovery and clean-up work after a vehicle fire .
louie lee-horton tweeted this footage of the scene .
car on fire on the m40 - expect delays # bbctravel # bbc # traffic # trafficalert
morning would you mind if we used your tweet on bbc online pls ?
i would n't mind atall , go for it !
thanks looks like you were the passenger ?
thanks vanessa
yeah , heading to london to film erich von däniken for a project we 're working on !
sounds fun here you go and thanks again video : car fire on the m40
thank you for your traffic tweet about the m40 .
it was used as part of the uk traffic tweets app
no worries , i hope the guys alright !

documents.title: polish shop completely destroyed by suspected arson attack
text: the fire service says 15 firefighters tackled a blaze overnight which has completely destroyed a polish food shop in coventry .
three engines were sent to the severe fire in remembrance road , willenhall .

documents.title: suspected arson attack at polish food shop
text: a severe fire at a polish food shop in coventry is being investigated as a suspected arson attack .
west midlands police was called to the blaze in remembrance road , willenhall , at 03:40 .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'severe ' shop fire in coventry
text: the fire service says it 's been dealing with a severe shop fire in coventry .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car cloning on the rise in the west midlands
text: motorway police are warning car cloning appears to be on the rise in the west midlands .
it involves criminals stealing a car 's details , making fake plates and then using the vehicle to commit other crimes .
laura marcus , from staffordshire , had her car cloned and later received a speeding ticket from london .
she says she was shocked and worried about proving she had n't broken the law .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: organisers pull out of coventry half marathon
text: the future of coventry 's half marathon is in doubt after the council confirmed organiser go2 will not be extending its contract , which ended after this year 's race .
the council says it 's disappointed and is unable to confirm whether the race will go ahead next year .
it adds it will now be `` actively looking at alternative options '' for delivering the event in the future .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: it 's a cloudy start with some showers , but then cloud will thin to bring some brighter sunny spells with highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the coventry newsroom
text: welcome to friday 's live feed , bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
you can get in touch with us via email , twitter or our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: live updates have now ended , but keep an eye out for more news , sport and travel into the evening and early morning .
we 'll be back with you from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: showers will die out during the evening , leaving a mostly dry and cloudy night with lows of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: what is the fit and proper owners test ? how does it affect coventry city ?
text: the football league and the football association have been asked to explain how coventry city owners sisu are able to pass the 'fit and proper ' owners test .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: sharp increase in bed blocking
text: monthly figures show delays hospitals experienced discharging patients reached a record high during august of this year .
in coventry and warwickshire hospitals , there were 4,803 days of delays in august 2016 , up from 3,496 in the same month last year .
these delays occur when there are no services available in the community to care for frail patients on release .

in a statement , coventry and warwickshire nhs trust said it was continuing to `` experience high demand for our accident and emergency services '' and working hard to discharge patients as soon as possible '' .
in particular we have seen a high number of older patients , many of whom have had acute medical needs and required periods of hospital admission .
many of these patients also have more complex needs which need to be considered before they can be discharged from hospital

documents.title: police release images following fan violence before sky blues match
text: five men wanted in connection with disorder before a coventry city match , have been identified by police .
they 've released cctv images of the men , suspected of being involved in the trouble before a match against northampton town on 27 august .
a 62-year-old man was assaulted and needed hospital treatment near to roab social club on foleshill road in coventry .
a further six men have been arrested and bailed while enquiries are on-going .

documents.title: snooker : chris wakelin beats ronnie o'sullivan
text: five-time world champion ronnie o'sullivan has lost 4-3 to world number 70 rugby 's chris wakelin at the english open .
o'sullivan toiled after going 2-0 ahead in the third round in manchester .
wakelin won the next three , but missed a pink to allow his rival , ranked 61 places higher , to level at 3-3 before holding his nerve in the decider .

documents.title: staysure to create 50 new jobs at its coventry contact centre
text: niche insurance and travel provider staysure has announced it is to create 50 new jobs at its coventry contact centre .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: headlines : fraud probe councillor degree criticised ; increase in bed blocking
text: here 's a recap of some of our headlining stories today :
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: complaints over coventry councillor 's posthumous award published
text: emails to the university of warwick criticising plans to award a posthumous degree to coventry councillor philip townshend have been published after a bbc freedom of information request .
townshend , who died in october 2015 , allegedly took out a mortgage on an elderly woman 's house without her knowing before his death in 2015 , but police never interviewed him .

one complainant said : `` to continue with this exceptional honour , whilst such serious allegations are pending , would be wholly inappropriate in these circumstances and bring the good name of the university into serious disrepute . ''
the university , which replied to all the complainants , refused to name who made the nomination .
university registrar ken sloan replied to a complaint saying the university `` followed standard procedure '' in deciding to make the award .
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: speedway : manager of coventry bees leaves club
text: team manager gary havelock has left the coventry bees , says the club.undefined
the former world champion spent four seasons in charge at brandon , reaching the elite league play-offs twice .
in a statement on the club 's website , coventry promoter mick horton said he wished him all the best for the future .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: serious nspcc cases jump in wake of savile scandal
text: the nspcc says in the past four years , since the savile scandal unravelled , it has seen a significant rise in the number of contacts serious enough to refer on to the police or to local children 's services .
in coventry in 2012-13 , it passed on 156 cases .
this rose to 261 in 2015-16 - a rise of 57 % .
the charity 's figures show :
these figures reveal a nation that is more alive to the issues of child abuse , following recent high-profile scandals and the ongoing investigation into non-recent child abuse

documents.title: police officer charged with gross misconduct over alleged theft
text: a police officer is appearing in front of a misconduct panel charged with gross misconduct .
pc michelle felton , based in the coventry and solihull areas , allegedly stole fuel while off duty .
the hearing in birmingham is scheduled to last two days .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: police launch search for escaped prisoner who has links to rugby
text: suffolk police are appealing to the public for their help in tracing a man who escaped from prison yesterday .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: world rugby hall of fame to open in november
text: a permanent home for world rugby 's hall of fame will be opened next month in the warwickshire town where the sport was invented .
william webb ellis is credited with creating the game when he the ball up and ran with it at rugby school almost 200 years ago .
twelve new members will be inducted into the hall of fame when it opens on 17 november .

documents.title: fraud probe councillor degree criticised
text: fraud probe councillor degree criticised
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: some dry and bright spells are forecast this afternoon , with highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: burst water main causes emergency road closure
text: an emergency road closure is in place at the junction of the b4115 and hill wootton road after a major burst on a water pipe in leek wootton .
severn trent said water supplies to customers should be unaffected , although some may be experiencing low pressure .
sam walter , team manager for severn trent , said : it 's one of our bigger pipes , so there 's lots of water and it really is n't safe for drivers to try and get through it . ''

documents.title: rugby : ton-up for coventry 's tom poole
text: coventry rugby second row tom poole is set to make his 100th appearence for the club when they take on fylde at the butts park arena this weekend .
director of rugby rowland winter 's made a series of changes because of injury and unavailability , including boris stankovich at loose head and phil boulton on the tight side .
sam harry replaces eoghan grace at openside flanker , while wasps loanee jack willis comes in at blindside for the injured brett daynes .
will maisey comes in at centre for tom wheatcroft , while the wasps pair of owain james and tom howe start on the wings .
fly-half tony fenner leads the side .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: lorry driver charged with causing death of stratford mum by careless driving
text: a lorry driver is set to appear at warwick crown court next month charged with causing the death of young stratford mum rachael martin by careless driving .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: cricket : ticket demand high for uk 's first day-night test match
text: ticket sales for the first day/night test match are up by more than 400 % in comparison to the first two days of last year 's test going on sale , says edgbaston .
the first day-night match will take place against west indies at the ground in august 2017 .
i think there is a lot of intrigue around the concept with spectators eager to be part of history .
we have hosted some thrilling international matches in recent years and the atmosphere generated from the edgbaston crowd should make this a unique and memorable occasion for supporters and players

documents.title: latest : city transport system considered ; nspcc referrals to social services jump
text: here 's a recap of some of our main stories today :
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: monopoly 'bard ' launched
text: a new monopoly board dedicated to shakespeare 's home town of stratford-upon-avon is being released .
among the locations on the game will be anne hathaway 's cottage , holy trinity church and shakespeare 's birthplace .
the latest edition has been specially created to mark the 400th anniversary of the playwright 's death .

documents.title: inspector suspects fowl play after birds rescued from m6 services
text: ducks and turkeys thought to have been abandoned have been up from a lorry park at services on the m6 .

the rspca was called to the site at corley services , between junctions two and three in warwickshire , after the two turkeys and four muscovy ducks were spotted grazing on a grass verge near the petrol station forecourt .
rspca inspector louise marston said : `` if they have strayed then we 'd like to reunite them with their owner .
`` or , if they were abandoned , then we are keen to find out who did this . ''
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest plan for student flats highlights tensions
text: on our front page this week : residents and students living in leamington 's old town are at loggerheads again over plans for further flats in the area .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: pupil hit by truck outside school
text: an 11-year-old schoolboy suffered a potentially serious head injury when he was hit by a truck outside his school yesterday , said the ambulance service .
the crash happened just before 15:15 outside woodfield school , in hawthorn lane , coventry .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jackknifed lorry in frolesworth
text: a jackknifed lorry is blocking frolesworth lane , in frolesworth , affecting bus services in the area .
more details on bbc travel .
# nuneaton , due to a jack-knifed lorry the bottom of folesworth rd is blocked , services are currently at a standstill .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: new city transport system considered
text: a review of coventry 's transport system has been launched which could see a very light rail system operating in the city .
councillors say planning is at an early stage but the tram-like service could link the city centre with the proposed hs2 line and the university of warwick .
coventry city council says the technology for the project is being developed in the city and the council would look to the new west midlands combined authority for funding .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest : proposals for new city transport link ; pupil hit by truck ; rugby hall of fame to open
text: these are some of our headlining stories today :
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

text: rugby museum set for november opening

text: today will be cloudy with widespread scattered showers , which may be heavy at times .
some dry and bright spells are forecast this afternoon , with highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: hay bale fire in coleshill
text: a fire burning about 100 hay bales broke out at a farm in coleshill last night .
the fire service says it left a water bowser overnight at the farm in packington lane and will be returning today to check the blaze is out .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: i 'm in the coventry newsroom today bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather for thursday .
you can get in touch with us via email , twitter or our facebook page .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: it 's been quite chilly today , but what is the weather situation like for the rest of the week ?
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: councillor in thump 'threat ' during heated coventry council meeting
text: tempers flared during a meeting of coventry city council as a senior labour member implied he would thump a fellow councillor .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: should coventry city council contact motorists over fines ?
text: thirteen thousand motorists have been wrongly fined for using a bus lane in coventry , but the council 's not planning to tell them .
a tribunal ruled that the £ 30 fines should n't have been issued because warning signs were inadequate .
the drivers are now entitled to a refund , but councillors decided not to waste public money by informing them .
tune into midlands today at 18:30 for the full story .
author: Joan Cummins
Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: it should be mostly dry but a bit chilly for the rest of the afternoon .
we might get the odd shower tonight with a low of 7c/45f .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: burst water pipe results in emergency road closure in leek wootton
text: severn trent has confirmed that a major water pipe has burst in leek wootton , leaving a busy road junction impassable .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: man dies in fall down lift shaft
text: man dies in fall down lift shaft

documents.title: new £ 700,000 scheme to tackle domestic violence
text: a £ 700,000 project to tackle domestic violence and abuse is being set up in the west midlands .
police and crime commissioner david jamieson has announced a two year domestic violence perpetrator programme which will target abusers .
experts will be employed to work closely with them on a specialist rehabilitation programme , and a support service for their families will be provided by the domestic violence consortium .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: police investigating death of man found at bottom of lift shaft
text: an investigation into the death of a man who was found at the bottom of a lift shaft at a business in warwick , has been launched by police .
the man died at the scene on tuesday afternoon .
mark plato , chief executive of telent technology services , where the man was found , said the company 's thoughts are with the man 's family .

documents.title: latest : man dies after being found in lift shaft ; transport secretary backs hs2 ; kiwi playmaker signs new wasps contract
text: these are the leading stories in coventry and warwickshire this afternoon :
- a man has died after being found at the bottom of a lift shaft in warwick
- transport secretary chris grayling says the government is still committed to the hs2 project
- wasps hand a new contract to new zealand-born fly-half jimmy gopperth
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: pupil up national diversity award
text: khia norman has earned herself a trip to london after her poem on racial equality won her a national award .
her effort , called 'we are all equal ' , scooped the primary school creative writing prize in the arts & minds competition run by teaching union nasuwt .
the judges praised the former camp hill primary school student 's `` mature '' technique and `` very clever '' use of well-known quotes .
spain , tunisia , england or japan/china , india or afghanistan/we are all different but equal

documents.title: hs2 : `` we need it for the jobs it will create ''
text: transport secretary chris grayling has announced £ 70m worth of funding for road safety and support for communities affected by the line to the midlands .
addressing a hs2 conference , mr grayling said : `` we need it for the boost it will give to our regional and national economies .
we need it for the jobs it will create , and for the way it will link our country together . ''
it comes as mps warned last month that ministers must setout a realistic timetable for delivering hs2 .
the public accounts committee ( pac ) was `` not convinced '' that the target for completing phase one between london and the west midlands by december 2026 will be met .

documents.title: man dies after being found at bottom of a lift shaft
text: a man has died after he was found at the bottom of a lift shaft in warwick .
he was found on tuesday afternoon at telent technology services , on haywood road .
west midlands ambulance service said he was confirmed dead at the scene .
warwickshire police is investigating , and the health and safety executive has also been informed .

documents.title: latest : greenbelt housing plans examined ; grayling reaffirms hs2 commitment ; sky blues fans plan day of action
text: here are some of the biggest stories around coventry and warwickshire this afternoon :
- plans to build about 5,000 homes on greenbelt land around coventry are being examined by the government 's planning inspector
- transport secretary chris grayling says the government is committed to the hs2 rail line
- coventry city fans announce a day of action to take place before this month 's match with rochdale
author: Alice Rosenthal
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: how can drivers get a refund over fines ?
text: a plan to write to motorists who were wrongly fined has been rejected - but drivers can still get a refund if they contact coventry city council .
a tribunal ruled drivers who received £ 30 fines for driving in bus lanes should not have received the penalty because the signs were n't properly authorised .
last night conservative councillors said drivers should be made aware , but the council said it had no legal obligation to contact motorists and it would cost too much money to write to all of them .
so far 412 have been refunded .
anyone who was issued with a ticket between 10 december 2015 and 21 april can write to or email the council if they 've been affected .

there is no requirement for us to write to motorists , and it would cost us many thousands of pounds to write to all of those affected - and as a council we have to be careful with every penny in the light of a rapidly decreasing budget .

documents.title: coventry city : day of action planned by fan groups
text: coventry city may have finally up a win in their last league match , but fans still are n't happy over off-field issues .
the fighting the jimmy hill way alliance , which is calling on owners sisu to sell the club , will host a `` day of action '' ahead of the home match with rochdale on 22 october .
they 're also asking fans to boycott the match at the ricoh arena .
the sky blues are currently bottom of league one .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: the curious tale of the dog in the rabbit hole
text: one curious dog learned how it feels to go down the rabbit hole - but then found himself on the wrong end of a rescue operation .
fox terrier zac managed to get himself stuck in a hole in a field in kineton , warwickshire .
nearly eight hours later , and after much digging by gaydon-based firefighters and a nearby construction crew , he was finally freed , much to the relief of his owner .
who ever said curiosity killed the cat ?
on his release , zac was a little shaky but was none the worse after his ordeal .

documents.title: gang netted £ 200,000 in series of shop raids
text: a member of a gang that stole cash and goods worth around £ 200,000 in a series of raids after planting covert cameras to capture staff members entering alarm codes has been jailed for two years .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: hs2 : just a `` vanity project ''
text: as we 've been reporting , the transport secretary chris grayling has given a speech regarding hs2 .
he said the government is `` not backing away '' from the rail link between london and birmingham , where it will terminate at curzon street station ( design below ) .
ukip transport spokesman jill seymour has expressed her disappointment at the government 's decision to press ahead with the hs2 rail link .
she said : `` hs2 has never been needed .
it is just a vanity project with an ever-growing budget , which is edging closer to the £ 100 billion mark .
it will never pay its way , and will always be a burden on the taxpayer . ''

documents.title: fly-half extends stay with wasps
text: new zealand-born fly-half jimmy gopperth has extended his stay with wasps .
the 33-year-old , who joined the club last season from leinster , is currently the top scorer in the aviva premiership with 90 points from six games .
the way the club 's going and the direction we 're moving in as a squad , the quality of players and coaching staff we have , it 's just a great fit .
i 've really enjoyed myself the last couple of years , especially this year , and i 'm loving my rugby playing alongside a great bunch of guys , so why not continue it ?
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest : greenbelt inspection due in coventry ; call to contact drivers over fines ; gopperth extends wasps stay
text: these are some of the main stories around coventry and warwickshire this lunchtime :
- a government inspector will face greenbelt campaigners in coventry as the city council 's draft local plan is examined
- coventry city council has a moral obligation to tell drivers who 've been fined for using bus-only junctions in the city that they could be in line for refunds according to opposition councillors
- new zealand-born fly-half jimmy gopperth is extending his stay with wasps
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: hs2 : government is `` not backing away ''
text: the government is `` not backing away '' from the rail link between london and the north , the government has said .
transport secretary chris grayling told an hs2 conference the the rail network is rapidly approaching `` crunch-point '' as out-dated rail lines are unable to keep up with demand .
`` we 're not backing away from hs2 .
the case is as strong as ever .
we need this railway .
and if we 're going to build it , let 's make it state-of-the-art , fit for the decades of growth ahead . ''
the first stage of hs2 will run between london and birmingham , through warwickshire .

documents.title: your sunny start in southam
text: it was a crisp and bright start in warwickshire this morning , as bbc weather watcher old salt 's from southam shows .
if you 've got a you 'd like to share , you can get in touch with us via email , twitter or our facebook page .

documents.title: coventry 's first asian officer marks 50 years since joining the police force
text: it 's 50 years since coventry 's first asian police officer joined the force .
mohammed yusuf daar , now 74 , had been serving in tanzania before moving to the west midlands in the spring of 1966 .
we feel lucky we opened the doors for others to join .
it 's encouraging to see more people from ethnic groups being part of the police now . ''
`` i was already experienced as an officer and wanted to join the force in the west midlands , '' he said .
`` i did n't really think about the impact or that i was making history in becoming the force 's first asian officer .
`` everyone was very welcoming and members of the public would come over and shake my hand .
i did not encounter any racism .

documents.title: rise in hospital allergy admissions
text: there 's been a 20 % rise in the number of people across coventry and wawrickshire being admitted to hospital with allergic reactions or anaphylatic shock .
figures from nhs england show 233 people were admitted in the last 12 months compared to 196 five years ago .
more than 29,000 people were admitted to hospitals across the country in 2015 .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: hs2 : compensation money being offered `` next to nothing ''
text: the government 's confirmed it 's to push ahead with hs2 - the rail line connecting birmingham and london - and going through the warwickshire countryside .
they 've unveiled a £ 70m fund to compensate communities affected , with £ 30m of that going on new road safety improvements .
kenilworth-based joe rukin from 'stop hs2 ' told the bbc the money being offered is n't enough .
it 's not going to go very far at all , it 's really next to nothing , when this money has got to spread out between birmingham and london .

documents.title: planning inspector to look at plans for 5,000 new homes
text: coventry 's draft local plan , which could see .
3,000 new homes built in the keresley green belt and 2,000 around eastern green and allesley , is being examined by the government 's planning inspector today .
campaigners are expected to protest outside the council house ahead of the meeting .

documents.title: plans to refund fined drivers thrown out
text: a plan to possibly refund motorists fined for driving through bus-only junctions in coventry has been thrown out .
a motion from the city 's conservative councillors , calling for the move , was defeated at a full council meeting .
they wanted drivers who had been fined to be contacted - because the warning signs for the junctions were n't in the right place - and refunds might be due .
these people are owed the money .
it would be very welcome i expect we think the council is morally obliged to write to everybody who was incorrectly fined because the signs were wrong explaining that they can get their money back .

documents.title: your calm in charlecote
text: weather watcher stevec sent in this from charlecote park in warwickshire .
if you 've got a you 'd like to share , you can get in touch with us via email , twitter or our facebook page .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: thousands of west midlands children to get free flu jab
text: nearly half a million children in the west midlands are to be offered free flu vaccinations this winter .
the stay well this winter campaign is the biggest-ever flu programme seen in the region .
this winter the programme will be extended to children in school year three ( seven and eight-year-olds ) .
it means in total , across the country , there are four million children eligible this year for the vaccination , which is given to them via a nasal spray rather than an injection .

chief medical officer prof dame sally davies said : `` flu can be much more dangerous for children than many patients realise and when children get flu they tend to spread it around the whole family . ''
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: latest : plans to contact fined drivers thrown out ; government confirms hs2 plans ; planning inspector due in coventry
text: the top stories in for coventry and warwickshire this morning include :
- plans for coventry city council to contact around 13,000 fined drivers over potential refunds have been thrown out by councillors
- the government 's confirmed it 's to push ahead with hs2
- a planning inspector is in coventry today looking at a draft local plan which could see 3,000 new homes in the kerseley green belt
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: coventry city midfielder signs new four-year deal
text: coventry city midfielder ben stevenson has signed a new four-year deal with his home-town team .
the academy product , 19 , joined the sky blues at the age of nine and his new contract runs until june 2020 .
`` everybody here looks forward to helping ben continue his progression , '' said caretaker manager mark venus .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: first exhibition for photographer who captured decades of coventry life
text: a 94-year-old photographer who has documented the arrival and lives of south asian immigrants to coventry since the 1950s is being exhibited in the city for the first time .
about 70 photographs taken by maganbhai patel - better known as masterji - between 1951 and the 1990s will be shown at the box , fargo village , in november .
masterji moved to coventry from surat in 1951 and worked in the city 's gec factory .
during his early years in england he used a box brownie to take photographs of friends .

exhibition curator jason tilley said : `` the work of masterji is of huge significance not just for coventry but the uk , because it 's a window into the lives of people as they arrived here and the image they wanted to send home . ''
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry named a dog poo hotspot in national survey
text: a new report out today has revealed that coventry city council had to issue 80 fixed penalty notices last year - fourth highest of any council .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: child abuser kenneth owen dies in prison
text: a former coventry children 's home worker , jailed for child cruelty , has died in prison .
kenneth owen , 71 , was serving a sentence of four years and four months at oakwood prison after being found guilty of five cruelty charges whilst working at wisteria lodge .
the prison service said owen , of boston in lincolnshire , died in hospital last wednesday .
his death was not sus there will be an independent investigation .

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: some misty patches possible for a time this morning on a mainly dry day with the risk of just a few showers .
a mix of sunny spells and plenty of cloud will see the temperatures up to 13c ( 55f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather for wednesday .
you can get in touch with us via email , twitter or our facebook page .

documents.title: stevenson signs four-year coventry deal
text: stevenson signs four-year coventry deal

documents.title: erdington and islington set for battle
text: erdington and islington set for battle
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: mediator considered over football row
text: mediator considered over football row

documents.title: our live coverage from tuesday
text: live updates have now ended , but keep an eye out for more news , sport and travel into the evening and early morning .
we 'll be back with you from 08:00 .

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: patchy cloud is forecast overnight with the possibility of some showers and lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: nuneaton mp 's plea to scrap car park plan
text: mp for nuneaton marcus jones is calling on warwickshire county council to reject plans for an 80-space car park near bermuda park station when it meets today .
the station opened in january this year as part of a £ 13.6m investment to improve rail services between coventry and nuneaton .
the council should `` rethink proposals '' , he said , which will `` jeopardise important employment land '' .
current owner of the land ups objects to council proposals for a compulsory purchase order , saying it is planning to create up to 150 new jobs at the site .
whilst i understand the committee 's motivation for rail car parking is laudable , the fact remains that in nuneaton we have a massive shortfall in employment land .
the first priority should be looking to encourage new industrial development and not prevent it
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: person rescued from lift shaft
text: a person was airlifted to hospital after falling down a lift shaft in warwick , says the ambulance service .
it happened at about 13:30 in haywood road .
author: Alice Rosenthal
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: roads closed in stratford for mop fair
text: the annual mop fair , in stratford-upon-avon , has started with some road closures in the town centre .
reminder : mop fair in # stratford from tuesday 11 october to wednesday 12 october , road closures in place -

documents.title: man admits possessing fighting dogs who were shot dead by police
text: a coventry man has admitted owning two fighting dogs who were shot dead by police during a dawn raid in the city .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: latest : government consider sky blues mediation ; two jailed for 1980s child rapes
text: here 's a recap of some of our main stories today :
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sports minister to raise coventry city problems with football league
text: the government is promising to raise the future of coventry city with the football league amid fresh concern the sky blues may have to leave the city yet again .
attending a parliamentary debate on the future of the sky blues , sports minister tracey crouch pledged to raise issues about the club with the league .
she said she hoped history would n't repeat itself and the club `` finds itself playing outside the city '' again .
she backed fans ' calls for clarity from the league over rules for clubs leaving their home cities and would be asking them to `` confirm its position '' .

documents.title: clown speaks out against 'creepy clowns ' craze
text: police say they 've received a surge of emergency calls reporting `` creepy clowns '' across the country , including across the west midlands .
pat the clown , based in birmingham , has spoken out against the craze which he believes is inspired by american films and could badly affect the clown industry .
it 's quite disgusting .
it 's potentially going to have an adverse effect on us if it persists .
i have been trying to play down the more negative aspects of clowns as somebody to be frightened of , for the last 25 years .
clowns are something that should be enjoyed by people , not feared

documents.title: men jailed for 1980s child rapes
text: two men who raped girls in nuneaton and bristol in the early 1980s have been jailed .
at warwick crown court , terry davies , ( left ) admitted rape along with a string of indecent assaults against two girls in the nuneaton area .
after a trial , owen jackson ( right ) was found guilty of raping one of the same girls on three occasions .
both men were jailed for 14 years on monday .

documents.title: school brings beach to landlocked rugby
text: an artificial beach built by a school in rugby which teaches children with special needs , will be unveiled to pupils on saturday .
head teacher chris pollitt said the beach , complete with a blackpool tram , `` had been kept secret behind a fence '' .
`` a lot of our children have complex special needs and travelling two hours to the beach at weston [ super-mare ] can be a difficult experience , '' he said .

documents.title: nominate your sporting unsung hero
text: the search is on to find the 2016 midlands sporting unsung hero .
we 're looking for those inspirational characters who get others into sport just for the love of it .
nominate your unsung hero on bbc sport .
the closing date is 23 october .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: video : sky blues fans ' charter presented to mp
text: a charter drawn up by coventry city fans has been handed to coventry mp jim cunningham at parliament , as mps debated the future of the club .

documents.title: mowbray wo n't be applying for shrewsbury town vacancy
text: while coventry city hunt for a new manager , former boss tony mowbray , has told our colleagues at bbc shropshire he wo n't be applying for the vacant position there .
former # coventry boss tony mowbray tells @ twitterid he will not be applying for the vacant # shrewsbury manager 's job
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: two arrested after crash leaves rover on its roof in foleshill
text: two teenagers were arrested on sus of theft after a rover ended up on its roof in foleshill .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: minister considers bringing in mediator to settle sky blues dispute
text: sports minister tracey crouch is to consider drafting in a mediator to help resolve the crisis at coventry city football club .
the government faced calls from coventry mp jim cunningham to `` get all sides together '' to resolve problems , at a parliamentary debate today .
the mp said unless club owners sisu decided to enter into a dialogue or sell up , then the future of the club `` hangs in the balance '' .

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: a settled afternoon , with the odd shower possible and highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: school brings beach to land-locked pupils
text: school brings beach to land-locked pupils

documents.title: video : stratford welcomes international big spenders
text: stratford-upon-avon is benefiting from international visitors , who spent an estimated extra £ 800m while holidaying in the uk last year than in the previous 12 months , a tourist group claims .
the figures published by visit britain show the biggest spenders are american , who splashed £ 3bn in the uk , but chinese tourists have just entered the top 10 for the first time .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: mp tells owners of coventry city to 'sell up '
text: the mp for coventry south jim cunningham has told parliament the owners of the sky blues should `` sell up '' .
in a debate , heard in westminster hall , he also said the football association and league should explain how the owners of the club could `` pass the fit and proper test '' to run a football club .
the club 's lease at the ricoh arena runs out out at the end of next season - with the league one outfit previously having spent a year playing at northampton because of financial problems .
the stadium landlord wasps has pulled out of talks over a new deal amid the threat of legal action by coventry 's owners sisu .
the football association and the football league must explain how such a company can pass the fit and proper test to proceed to run a club into the ground .
no stadium , no manager and the academy under threat

documents.title: latest : mps debate coventry city ; one hurt in m6 crash
text: here 's a recap of some of our stories today :
- mps debate the future of coventry city football club
- one taken to hospital after crash on m6 southbound
- nuneaton mp 's plea to scrap car park plan
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more than 1,600 jobs planned for former jaguar factory site
text: more than 1,600 jobs could be created at a new distribution depot on the site of the old jaguar factory in coventry .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: one hurt in m6 accident
text: one person 's been hurt in a crash on the m6 southbound between junctions two and one , says the ambulance service .
it says the patient is `` fully conscious and breathing '' and not thought to have life-threatening injuries after the crash between a lorry and a car at 10:23 .
two lanes of the m6 southbound remain closed between junctions six and five due to a separate collision , but the ambulance service says it 's not attending that one .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mps to debate the future of coventry city fc
text: the coventry mp who 's tabled a parliamentary debate on the sky blues says he 's hoping to find out if there 's been discussions behind the scenes between the government , the club and the football league .
mps are discussing the future of the club in westminster hall .
the mp for coventry south jim cunningham said a lot would hinge on how the minister responds today .
representatives from the fan 's organisation the sky blue trust handed over their charter ahead of the meeting .
author: Martin Winch
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: sky blues signing : ben stevenson signs four-year deal
text: coventry city midfielder ben stevenson has signed a new contract with the club , securing him until june 2020 .
the 19-year-old has been with the club since the age of nine and has featured in 10 matches this season .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: cricket : warwickshire look to restructure coaching team
text: warwickshire 's chief executive says he 's reviewing the coaching structure at the club as part of his recruitment of a new director of cricket .
the bears are looking for a replacement for dougie brown , who left the club after 27 years ' service .
neil snowball said it was an opportunity to consider a reorganisation .
we 've got an aging squad , we need someone who 's going to help make that transition through to bringing the younger players through .
so i think it 's time for me to reflect and look at the structure of the cricket department and bring someone in to lead that
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: blind woman has bag stolen in shameful coventry city centre theft
text: a blind woman - sat next to her guide dog - had her bag pinched while she was sitting in a city centre council office .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: football : sky blues reveal extent of operating loss
text: coventry city chairman tim fisher has told a fans group the club has to continue selling players to make ends meet , even though the financial position has improved

the club has published the minutes of its latest meeting with the supporters consultative group , at which fisher revealed the club 's operating loss before player sales has fallen from £ 3.8m to £ 1.7m this year .

he added the club needed to own its stadium and said there were credible plans to move to coventry rugby club 's butts park arena , but these were on hold due to what he called a `` political embargo '' .
he said this was in place from coventry city council while the club 's owners sisu continued with legal action against the authority .
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: council forced to investigate 'doctored ' legal bus gate documents
text: coventry city council has launched an official investigation into allegations that someone within the council doctored legal documents regarding controversial bus lane fines .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: latest : sky blues debated at westminster ; and mp 's plea to scrap car park plan
text: some of our top stories today include :
- future of coventry city debated in westminster
- mp for nuneaton calls on council to reject bermuda park car park plans
- sky blues reveal extent of operating loss
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: future of coventry city debated in westminster
text: a fans ' charter will be presented to mps today as they debate the future of coventry city football club in parliament .
the sky blues are bottom of league one and supporters are planning to boycott a match in protest at the owners ' management of the club .
the debate at westminster hall has been organised by local mp jim cunningham , who wants the government and football league to intervene on a number of issues .

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: after a few early mist and fog patches , it 's a bright and sunny start to the day with highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

text: i 'm in the coventry newsroom and we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather for tuesday .
get involved using email , twitter or our facebook page .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: live updates for coventry and warwickshire have now ended , but keep an eye out for updates into the evening and early morning .
we 'll be back with you from 08:00 with the usual news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: any showers will ease overnight leaving clear spells and lows of 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: nobel prize for warwick economics graduate
text: a warwick economics graduate - and later honorary graduate - has been awarded the nobel prize in economics .
prof oliver hart was recognised for his work on contract theory , researching how contracts make society function .

documents.title: have a say about the future of wootton wawen
text: people in wootton wawen are being given the chance to have a say in how their village develops over the coming years .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: appeal for information after distraction burglary in wellesbourne
text: police are appealing for information after a distraction burglary took place in wellesbourne .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: latest : critically injured footballer recovering ; police taser m6 crash driver
text: here 's a recap of some of our main stories today :
- rugby town defender elliot palmer recovering well in hospital , says club
- police use taser to detain driver involved in m6 crash
- man remanded over historical schoolgirl abduction
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: report identifies concerns for warwickshire 's mental health services
text: delays in accessing mental health services and a lack of understanding about treatment plans are problems highlighted in a report by healthwatch warwickshire .

researchers looked at mental health services in the county and also raised concerns about poor co-ordination between gps and health services and a general lack of mental health understanding by doctors .
len mackin , from the organisation , said the `` hard hitting '' report contained a number of recommendations on how to improve the service at every stage .

documents.title: masked carjackers rob bmw driver at gunpoint in terrifying attack outside solihull home
text: an accountant has told of the terrifying moment he was carjacked at gunpoint outside his solihull home by masked robbers .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: police taser m6 crash driver
text: police used a taser to detain the driver of a car involved in a crash on the m6 southbound earlier .
they say concerns were raised for the driver 's safety following `` threats he made to himself and others '' after the single-vehicle crash between junctions two and one .
he was taken to hospital for treatment following injuries in the collision and , they say , no arrests have been made .
opu in attendance collision on the # m6 2-1 driver absconded .
has been located by officers with taser being deployed .
1 male in custody .
rp
hi , do you have an incident number for this ?
cheers .

documents.title: i felt pretty invisible : pro boxer talks of depression to highlight campaign
text: former coventry city footballer and professional boxer leon mckenzie said he felt invisible , isolated and very alone during a period of depression which led to a suicide attempt .
he was speaking to highlight a new campaign by mental health charity mind - it takes balls to talk .
suicide is the main cause of death in men under the age of 50 in the west midlands .
when i was going through it i felt pretty invisible .
you feel very alone and isolated .
at that particular point in my life i was n't brave enough to step forward and say i 'm struggling

documents.title: will warehouse : top secret location in the west midlands
text: for the first time , cameras have gone behind the scenes of a top secret location in the west midlands which houses everyone 's wills .
the warehouse holds 41 million documents , including those of famous midlanders and celebrities .
it also contains the wills of almost 300,000 soldiers , some of which were written on the battlefields of world war one .
you can see more on this on bbc one tonight from 19:30 .
author: BBC Inside Out

documents.title: type 2 diabetes : data shows spread of disease
text: data analysis shows at the current rate of growth , it 's predicted there will be five million people with type 2 diabetes in 2020 - five years earlier than anticipated .
the boroughs of nuneaton and bedworth and north warwickshire have been named as two of england 's hotspots where the most prescriptions are issued .

data analysis company exasol said the data showed in the first six months of 2016 , the number of prescriptions for type 2 diabetes was already up by more than 8 % compared with the same period the year before .
there are estimated to be 3.5 million adults with type 2 diabetes in the uk .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry city crisis sees football league agree to meet mp and answer questions
text: the football league has agreed to meet a coventry mp after she criticised their response to the telegraph 's questions over the future of coventry city .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: critically injured player clashed with team goalkeeper
text: rugby town player elliot palmer was involved in a collision with fellow teammate , goalkeeper louis connor , said club official tony mann .
`` the ball was running back to our keeper who was rushing out , '' he said .
`` it was a 50/50 ball and one of their strikers was also going for it and elliot collided with our keeper . ''
the club says the defender is in good spirits and hoping to move out of the critical care unit today .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: some bright spells will be around this afternoon with light winds and highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: your questions : will identities survive the west midlands 'super council ' ?
text: mick freer used your questions to ask : `` will the proud independent identities of birmingham and the black country survive their merger under the west midlands combined authority ? ''
ukip west midlands mep bill etheridge said regional identity will be taken away `` over my dead body '' .
what have you always wondered about coventry & warwickshire ?
ask us here and your question could be making the news .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: church to be reopened contains 'historically important ' mural
text: the coventry church to be reopened to worshipers after 45 years contains a 1960s mural recognised as historically important by english heritage .
the mural , on a wall inside st mark 's church , was painted in 1963 by german-born jew hans feibusch , who fled from nazis in 1933 .
the mural 's recognition means it will have protected status .
the bishop of coventry said they hoped to reopen the church to parishioners next year .

documents.title: latest : critically injured footballer recovering well ; warwickshire hotspots for type 2 diabetes
text: these are some of our main stories today :
- rugby town defender elliot palmer hoping to move out of critical care unit
- parts of warwickshire revealed as type 2 diabetes 'hotspots '
- coventry church to reopen targeting a student congregation
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man remanded over 2001 schoolgirl abduction
text: a man has been remanded in custody charged with the abduction of a schoolgirl in staffordshire 15 years ago .
arnold baxter , 72 , of bath street , rugby , warwickshire is accused of kidnap and indecent assault after an incident in barton-under-needwood in 2001 .
he is due to appear at stafford crown court on 11 november .

documents.title: critically injured footballer recovering well after match collision
text: a footballer critically hurt when he and another player collided during a match at the weekend is recovering well in hospital , his club says .
rugby town says defender elliot palmer is hoping to move out of the critical care unit after crashing into another player during a match on saturday .
the player suffered three broken ribs and bleeding on a kidney and his liver during the match against local rivals bedworth united .
update on elliot palmer : elliot has been in good spirits & recovering well - hoping to move out of the critical care unit today .
great news all the best from @ twitterid # nonleaguefamily
that 's great news hope you get well soon elliot
get well soon elliot
that 's great news
great news
